baseURI().details: Returns the base URI set via {_setBaseURI}. This will be automatically added as a prefix in {tokenURI} to each token's URI, or to the token ID if no specific URI is set for that token ID.

burn(uint256).details: Only callable if the media owner is also the creator.

isApprovedOrOwner(address,uint256).details: Public method which returns whether `spender` is allowed to manage `tokenID`. Requirements: - `tokenID` must exist.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

permit(address,uint256,(uint256,uint8,by.details: This method is loosely based on the permit for ERC-20 tokens in  EIP-2612, but modified for ERC-721.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

returns._0: the metadata URI for the token

tokenURI(uint256).details: This function is an override of the base OZ implementation because we will return the tokenURI even if the media has been burned. In addition, this protocol does not support a base URI, so relevant conditionals are removed.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

updateTokenMetadataURI(uint256,string).details: only callable by approved or owner

updateTokenURI(uint256,string).details: only callable by approved or owner

devdoc.title: A media value system, with perpetual equity to creators

configure(address,address).notice: Sets the market contract address. This address is the only permitted address that can call the mutable functions.

constructor.notice: On deployment, set the market contract address and register the ERC721 metadata interface

revokeApproval(uint256).notice: Revoke the approvals for a token. The provided `approve` function is not sufficient for this protocol, as it does not allow an approved address to revoke it's own approval. In instances where a 3rd party is interacting on a user's behalf via `permit`, they should revoke their approval once their task is complete as a best practice.

setBidFromApp(uint256,(uint256,address,a.notice: Custom version of setBid where App must be onlyApprovedOrOwnersee IMedia

setLazyBidFromApp(uint256,(uint8,string,.notice: Custom version of setBid where App must be onlyApprovedOrOwnersee IMedia

tokenExists(uint256).notice: Helper to check that token has not been burned or minted

tokenMetadataURI(uint256).notice: Return the metadata URI for a piece of media given the token URI

tokenURI(uint256).notice: return the URI for a particular piece of media with the specified tokenId

userdoc.notice: This contract provides an interface to mint media with a market owned by the creator.
